{{DISPLAYTITLE:<samp>gui.png-atlas</samp>}}
{{exclusive|java}}
[[File:25w20a gui.png-atlas.png|thumb|<samp>gui.png-atlas</samp> in [[Java Edition 1.21.9]].]]
'''<samp>gui.png-atlas</samp>''' is a procedurally-generated [[texture atlas]] used to store textures for many [[GUI|GUI elements]].

== Format ==
<samp>gui.png-atlas</samp> is a generated 1024&times;512-pixel file that stores textures for many GUI elements.

== Bleeding ==
There are several known ways in which to render parts of this atlas through unintended means:
* In 23w31a, editing the NBT of a furnace such that its fuel time or cooking duration exceeds normal values causes these elements to display areas outwith the normal bounds.<ref>{{bug|MC-264260}}</ref>
* Having a greater amount of XP than what is needed to reach the next level also causes the atlas to bleed.<ref>{{bug|MC-267877}}</ref> For some versions, this requires resizing of the window to see. Values of XpP 11734884 and above will instead render an empty bar. 
* If the border value for nine_slice scaling is specified to be greater than or equal to 2{{sup|30}} in mcmeta files, the elements in question is replaced with other parts of the atlas accordingly due to integer overflow.<ref>{{bug|MC-269154}}</ref>
* The jump bar at full capacity renders an around one pixel wide area of the atlas it shouldn't, which are usually transparent and therefore unnoticeable.<ref>{{bug|MC-269295}}</ref>{{until|java 1.21.11}}
